intro: Monardella villosa subsp. sheltonii, commonly known as Shelton’s tickseed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and slightly different floral structure compared to other Monardella species.
